attributes.description: Nominal mechanical input power provided by the aircraft prime mover to drive the generator.
attributes.name: inputMechanicalPower

attributes.description: Regulated electrical output power delivered to the aircraft's electrical bus under standard operating conditions.
attributes.name: outputElectricalPower

attributes.description: Efficiency of converting mechanical energy to electrical energy, optimized for minimal energy losses.
attributes.name: conversionEfficiency

attributes.description: Operating temperature range ensuring generator performance under extreme flight conditions.
attributes.name: operatingTemperature

attributes.description: Compliance with aviation generation and safety standards ensuring reliability and safety in flight.
attributes.name: compliance

designScenario.description: The Generator System is an onboard power generation unit designed to convert mechanical energy from the aircraft's prime mover into electrical power. It ensures continuous and reliable electrical supply for critical flight and avionics systems, even during peak demands and transient operational conditions. The system is engineered with modularity and robustness in mind, resembling line-replaceable units (LRUs) found in modern aircraft, and integrates advanced safety features, high efficiency, and real-time diagnostic capabilities.
designScenario.name: Generator System

details.description: Must generate AC power from mechanical input with rapid start/stop sequences based on engine RPM variations.
Should automatically synchronize with aircraft power distribution systems during various flight phases.
Maintain stable voltage output under rapid load changes analogous to transient conditions in flight.
Ensure high conversion efficiency during both nominal and peak power generation cycles.
Incorporate overvoltage, overcurrent, and thermal protection mechanisms to prevent electrical faults.
Implement isolation and emergency shutdown protocols to safeguard avionics.
Modular design for rapid maintenance, upgrades, and field replacement, similar to aircraft LRUs.
Minimize acoustic noise and electromagnetic interference to comply with cabin and avionics standards.

relationships.description: The Generator Core Unit depends on the Fuel Supply & Control Unit to provide a steady fuel flow required for mechanical power generation.
The Cooling System is composed as an integral part of the overall Generator System, ensuring thermal regulation for the Generator Core Unit during high-load operations.
The Protection & Monitoring Module is associated with the Generator Core Unit to continuously safeguard and monitor the electrical output against anomalies.
The Control and Communication Interface aggregates data from the Protection & Monitoring Module to provide real-time diagnostics and remote control capabilities.

systemComponents.description: The primary unit responsible for converting mechanical energy into electrical power using an alternator, equipped with voltage regulation and excitation control mechanisms analogous to aircraft generator modules.
systemComponents.name: Generator Core Unit

subComponents.description: High-frequency alternator that converts mechanical motion into AC power, designed for variable engine speeds.
subComponents.name: Alternator

subComponents.description: Voltage regulator unit ensuring stable output voltage despite fluctuating engine inputs.
subComponents.name: Voltage Regulator

subComponents.description: Exciter that provides the necessary initial current to kickstart the alternator, similar to starter circuits in aircraft systems.
subComponents.name: Exciter

systemComponents.description: Manages the delivery and precise control of fuel to the prime mover, ensuring consistent energy input under different flight conditions.
systemComponents.name: Fuel Supply & Control Unit

subComponents.description: Fuel pump designed to supply fuel at a regulated flow rate adhering to aviation standards.
subComponents.name: Fuel Pump

subComponents.description: Injector controller that adjusts fuel delivery based on real-time engine performance requirements.
subComponents.name: Fuel Injector Controller

systemComponents.description: Provides thermal management to the Generator System by dissipating excess heat and maintaining optimal operational temperatures during high power generation.
systemComponents.name: Cooling System

subComponents.description: Radiator that efficiently dissipates heat into the ambient environment.
subComponents.name: Radiator

subComponents.description: Cooling fan that enhances airflow across critical components to improve heat dissipation.
subComponents.name: Cooling Fan

systemComponents.description: Ensures the safety and reliability of the Generator System by monitoring operational parameters and providing emergency disconnect in case of faults, akin to aircraft circuit protection modules.
systemComponents.name: Protection & Monitoring Module

subComponents.description: Circuit breaker that interrupts power flow in the event of overload or fault conditions.
subComponents.name: Circuit Breaker

subComponents.description: Thermal sensor continuously monitors temperature, enabling proactive shutdown during thermal excursions.
subComponents.name: Thermal Sensor

systemComponents.description: Provides a user interface for real-time monitoring, control, and data logging of the Generator System, interfacing with flight management systems.
systemComponents.name: Control and Communication Interface

subComponents.description: Digital interface panel that displays operational parameters and system alerts in the cockpit.
subComponents.name: Digital Interface

subComponents.description: Flight data recorder that logs system performance data for maintenance and fault analysis.
subComponents.name: Flight Data Recorder
